content: Atrial Fibrillation: Irregularly irregular rhythm with absent P waves. Types: paroxysmal (self-terminating <7d), persistent (>7d), permanent (accepted). Symptoms: palpitations, dyspnea, fatigue, chest discomfort; may be asymptomatic. ECG: irregularly irregular RR intervals, no discrete P waves, fibrillatory waves. Causes: HTN, valvular disease, CAD, HF, hyperthyroidism, alcohol, sleep apnea, post-cardiac surgery. Rate control: BB (metoprolol), CCB (diltiazem), digoxin. Rhythm control: cardioversion, antiarrhythmics (amiodarone, flecainide). Anticoagulation: CHA2DS2-VASc score (≥2 men, ≥3 women = anticoagulate); HAS-BLED score for bleeding risk. Complications: stroke (5x risk), HF, tachycardia-induced cardiomyopathy.
name: Atrial Fibrillation - Classification & Management
